1.title: The Eagle and the Osprey
1.plot: A bank robbery ends in a shooting, giving Mayor Sawyer Crane more leverage against Walt. When Henry goes missing, Cady tells Walt about her disturbing vision.

2.title: Fever
2.plot: While Henry recuperates, Walt investigates the murder of a goat farmer whose land is popular with treasure hunters.

3.title: Thank You, Victoria
3.plot: Chance Gilbert's court appearance takes a dramatic turn that pulls Walt away from the civil suit and puts him and Vic on a showdown.

4.title: A Thing I'll Never Understand
4.plot: An emotional Vic re-examines her life. Henry and Nighthorse team up against Malachi. Ferg helps his girlfriend Meg's mother with the tribal police.

5.title: Burned Up My Tears
5.plot: As the trial for his civil suit begins things don't look good for Walt especially after a murder leaves Vic and Walt as suspects.

6.title: No Greater Character Endorsement
6.plot: The bizarre death of a drug dealer points to a new and violent Hector. Cady helps a sick child whose parents don't trust Western medicine.

7.title: Opiates and Antibiotics
7.plot: Walt wonders if a presumed dead member of the Irish Mob is alive. Mathias questions Cady about Catori. A mobile clinic raises Henry's suspicions.

8.title: Cowboy Bill
8.plot: As Ferg works on the Cowboy Bill case, Vic and Walt try to find Shane Muldoon. Cady's office is trashed.

9.title: Running Eagle Challenge
9.plot: Vic gets a surprise visit from her father. An FBI agent helps Walt pin down the mole working for Malachi. A tough race enables Vic to move forward.

10.title: Goodbye Is Always Implied
10.plot: Nighthorse's problems at the casino escalate. Walt gets an unexpected visitor. An inevitable confrontation leads to lives changed.

1.title: Pilot
1.plot: Sheriff Longmire runs a small department in rural Wyoming. When the body of a man is found in the woods the investigation leads to tension between Longmire and the local Indian Reservation, as well as between Longmire and his Indian friend who runs a local bar.

2.title: The Dark Road
2.plot: When the body of a young girl is found at a rest stop with a bunch of money, the investigation leads to a group of young Mennonites on rumspringa.

3.title: A Damn Shame
3.plot: A barn fire kills not only several prize winning show horses but also the owner. As the investigation continues, it starts to look more like an insurance fraud gone wrong.

4.title: The Cancer
4.plot: A double homicide helps uncover a shocking partnership between the Cheyenne reservation and a Mexican drug cartel.

5.title: Dog Soldier
5.plot: Cheyenne boys are disappearing, and the case may be connected to dishonest child welfare workers, a Cheyenne warrior legend, and an an ambitious Cheyenne political leader.

6.title: The Worst Kind of Hunter
6.plot: A paroled killer is mauled by a bear, but Longmire suspects that there is more to the story. Meanwhile, Branch's uncle creates havoc for the sheriff's department.

7.title: 8 Seconds
7.plot: Called to a home invasion, Walt and Vic find the critically injured Chris Sublette, a rodeo sponsor who has just dropped a rider accused of mistreating his horses. As the case unfolds, multiple motives come to light. Could it be revenge, theft, jealousy, or something more sinister?

8.title: An Incredibly Beautiful Thing
8.plot: A highly agitated young girl approaches a gas station owner for help. When Sheriff Longmire attends the scene, the owner is dead and the girl is missing. Investigations lead Longmire to existence of a religious cult in the neighboring Cumberland county.

9.title: Dogs, Horses and Indians
9.plot: The president of the Reservation Tribal Council is run off the road, shot and killed. Inquiries reveal that the president recently pushed though a council amendment to the blood percentage rule, thereby excluding a significant number of tribe members from their entitlements.

10.title: Unfinished Business
10.plot: When Walt is called to the scene of a murder of a local youth, he instantly recognizes him as one of a group of four boys who were acquitted of the rape of an developmentally challenged Cheyenne girl. With the cause of death being an arrow to the chest, Walt must act very carefully as tribal tensions are still high surrounding the failed rape case. Meanwhile, the relationship between Walt and Branch continues to break down, and a Denver detective arrives in town to interview Walt about another murder case.

1.title: Unquiet Mind
1.plot: Longmire risks his life to travel up a mountain by foot in a snowstorm to catch a group of escaped prisoners and their hostages.

2.title: Carcasses
2.plot: Sheriff Longmire discovers that a man found dead in a compost heap had made lots of enemies, and Branch looks for help as he tries to find Cady.

3.title: Death Came in Like Thunder
3.plot: A murdered sheep farmer is killed over a deal to sell his land, and Cady goes to Denver to find answers about her mother's death.

4.title: The Road to Hell
4.plot: A truckload of cattle is stolen, and the original driver later turns up dead. Meanwhile, Vic receives a mysterious delivery of flowers from a possible admirer.

5.title: Party's Over
5.plot: The body of a young girl found dumped in an alley leads Longmire to a gang dealing in stolen prescription medications. Cady returns home after investigating her mother's death.

6.title: Tell It Slant
6.plot: An Indian psychic is found dead after what appears to be a home reading session. An investigation of her records leads Walt and his deputies in numerous directions, including the search for a missing girl and the location of secret Indian grave sites within the county. Meanwhile, the time for the debate between Walt and Branch has arrived.

7.title: Sound and Fury
7.plot: While serving at the Red Pony, Henry overhears a customer trying to organize a hit on his wife. When the customer leaves, Henry follows him to the car park to volunteer for the job.

8.title: The Great Spirit
8.plot: A foreman is shot and killed and found dragging behind a horse after an illegal rodeo, and Detective Fales comes to Henry with questions about his investigation.

9.title: Tuscan Red
9.plot: A local Cheyenne is found dead in a house after a methane explosion, but the emotionally sensitive investigation could cost Longmire points in the upcoming election.

10.title: Election Day
10.plot: The day of the sheriff's election arrives, but everybody is more concerned about Cady, who is critically injured in a hit-and-run accident.

11.title: Natural Order
11.plot: While the sheriff's office investigates the death of a game warden and the illegal shooting of an elk, Branch tries to figure out his future after losing the election.

12.title: A Good Death Is Hard to Find
12.plot: Longmire needs Lucien Connally's help after a convicted dinosaur bone thief is killed in prison, and Vic continues to be harassed by an old enemy from Philadelphia.

13.title: Bad Medicine
13.plot: Branch ties Jacob Nighthorse to Cady's accident after a suspicious suicide, Vic takes matters into her own hands with her stalker, and detective Fales returns to town to put the heat on Walt and Henry.

1.title: The White Warrior
1.plot: Longmire investigates Branch's shooting, but Branch insists that he was shot by a dead man. Meanwhile, Henry goes to prison after being arrested for killing Longmire's wife's killer.

2.title: Of Children and Travelers
2.plot: While Longmire and Vic investigate the murder of a troubled runaway teenager of Russian descent, Henry runs into big troubles in prison.

3.title: Miss Cheyenne
3.plot: Longmire investigates the murder of a doctor while also replacing Henry as a judge for a beauty contest on the reservation. Meanwhile, Cady represents Henry at his bail hearing.

4.title: In the Pines
4.plot: After a wilderness leadership trip takes a dark turn, Walt and the team must track down a killer and missing teenaged campers. Branch, meanwhile, continues his unsanctioned pursuit of his shooter.

5.title: Wanted Man
5.plot: Longmire and Lucian Connolly work together to track down three suspects in his wife's murder, Henry searches for the man who can prove his innocence, and Branch's investigation tactics nearly get him in trouble with the law.

6.title: Reports of My Death
6.plot: A dead body Longmire discovers on a park bench may be the long-missing heir of a large fortune, and Henry breaks his house arrest to investigate Malachi Strand and Jacob Nighthorse.

7.title: Population 25
7.plot: After a car accident, Vic and her husband Sean are captured by a survivalist who is also a suspect connected with sheriff Longmire's wife's murder, and Longmire is forced to work with Ed Gorski to get them out.

8.title: Harvest
8.plot: Longmire investigates the death of a farmer who was about to be evicted from his land, Branch and Cady investigate a lead in Denver on behalf of Henry, and Vic contemplates her future with the sheriff's department.

9.title: Counting Coup
9.plot: Branch has proof that David Ridges is alive, and Longmire connects him to Jacob Nighthorse. Meanwhile, Sean makes Longmire serve divorce papers to Vic, and Henry faces another setback related to his trial.

10.title: Ashes to Ashes
10.plot: After killing David Ridges, sheriff Longmire uncovers a clue that could prove that Ridges killed Miller Beck. Meanwhile, Branch is curious about a possible relationship between his father and Jacob Nighthorse.

1.title: Down by the River
1.plot: In the wake of discovering a dead body in the river from a supposed suicide, Walt soon discovers evidence pointing to murder. Walt makes it his mission to bring Nighthorse to justice.

2.title: War Eagle
2.plot: The investigation into Branch's death continues. Walt looks into a death at the old Japanese internment camp. Henry considers taking up where Hector left off.

3.title: High Noon
3.plot: Cady gets a new job offer while Vic worries Walt wants her to lie for him. Nighthorse continues his egotistical posturing and Barlow implodes with his own malice.

4.title: Four Arrows
4.plot: Walt moves on after a standoff with Barlow. A tourist is found dead in a luggage bag left behind a tour bus heading to the casino, causing more tension between Walt and Nighthorse. Henry looks to help an abused mother and her son.

5.title: Help Wanted
5.plot: Walt suspects a chain robbery when a late veterans husband is shot during a break in and a warehouse full of pharmaceuticals is robbed. The sheriffs department is scouting for new recruits.

6.title: The Calling Back
6.plot: A young Cheyenne girl is raped on the reservation, creating problems between the wildcatters at the oil rig workers and the Cheyenne people. Vic is evicted from her home, forcing her to move in with Cady.

7.title: Highway Robbery
7.plot: A highway robbery which leaves one person dead and another barely alive, sets off an investigation involving a string of robberies. Henry begins taking steps in bringing justice to Gabriela's attackers.

8.title: Hector Lives
8.plot: When a former suspect in a rape case ends up dead in another county, Walt and Vic aren't convinced the death is an accident.

9.title: Shotgun
9.plot: The shooting of Gab's remaining rapist has unintended consequences. Walt tries to figure out motives for the deaths and continues spending time with Dr Moynihan. Henry takes Gab to a medicine woman. Zack has a stalker.

10.title: What Happens on the Rez...
10.plot: Henry gets Gab to safety but danger follows. Ferg misses Zack and Vic missteps with Eamon. Walt meets the medicine woman and progresses with the Doc. Mathias makes an arrest in the 'Hector lives' campaign. Jacob makes a proposal to Cady.

1.title: A Fog That Won't Lift
1.plot: A shaky Walt searches for Donna as he and Vic reconstruct what happened in the cabin. Mathias has a deal for Henry. Cady tells Walt about a job offer.

2.title: One Good Memory
2.plot: Henry renegotiates his deal with Mathias. Walt's search for Donna leads to too many suspects. A phone message sends Walt down an unexpected path.

3.title: Chrysalis
3.plot: Walt unravels the puzzling case of a girl and her missing father. Henry helps Cady find a place on the rez. Malachi and Jacob's alliance is weakening.

4.title: The Judas Wolf
4.plot: The CEO of a Nebraska-based drug company is abducted during a hunting trip with the Mayor. Matthias pushes Henry into bringing down a drug dealer whose product is killing people on the rez. Cady renovates her new firm.

5.title: Pure Peckinpah
5.plot: Mathias and Walt must work together to solve a drug-related murder. Vic moves out of Cady's place. Hector's enemies multiply.

6.title: Objection
6.plot: Ferg fears for his life after a prisoner transport goes wrong. Walt's civil case depositions go poorly. With help from Henry and Vic, Walt gets closer to the kingpin at Manifest Destinations.

7.title: From This Day Forward
7.plot: When treasure hunters discover a body in a hollow tree, Walt finds a connection to an old case. Cady struggles to help a battered woman on the reservation.

8.title: Stand Your Ground
8.plot: Walt looks deeper into the Irish mob. Henry finds the book he needs, while Cady gets legal advice. Malachi and Jacob lob accusations at each other.

9.title: Continual Soiree
9.plot: Walt's obsession with Jacob leads to more tension with Cady. Vic testifies against Gilbert. Walt's anger erupts at the Red Pony.

10.title: The Stuff Dreams Are Made Of
10.plot: Walt gets more bad news from the mayor. Vic does a strange favor. As Walt learns what's behind the lawsuit, Henry and Cady each face tribal rituals.

imdb.plot outline: Walt Longmire is the charismatic, dedicated and unflappable sheriff of Absaroka County. Widowed only a year, Longmire is a man in psychic repair that buries his pain behind a brave face and dry wit. Struggling since his wife's death and at the urging of his daughter, Cady, Longmire knows that the time has come to turn his life around. With the help of Vic, a female deputy new to the department, he becomes reinvigorated about his job and committed to running for re-election. When Branch, an ambitious, young deputy decides to run against him for sheriff, Longmire feels betrayed but remains steadfast in his dedication to the community. Longmire often turns to close friend and confidant Henry Standing Bear for support as he sets out to rebuild both his personal and professional life, one step at a time.
imdb.title: Longmire
plot: Walt _Longmire_ (qv) is the dedicated and unflappable sheriff of Absaroka County, Wyoming. Widowed only a year, he is a man in psychic repair but buries his pain behind his brave face, unassuming grin and dry wit.::Anonymous

Struggling since his wife's death and at the urging of his daughter, Cady, _Longmire_ (qv) knows that the time has come to turn his life around. With the help of Vic, a female deputy new to the department, he becomes reinvigorated about his job and committed to running for re-election. When Branch, an ambitious, young deputy decides to run against him for sheriff, _Longmire_ (qv) feels betrayed but remains steadfast in his dedication to the community. _Longmire_ (qv) often turns to close friend and confidant Henry Standing Bear for support as he sets out to rebuild both his personal and professional life, one step at a time.::A&E TV
